sections.heading: Repealed by Laws 2005, Ch. 207, 2
sections.text: Section 10-6-102 - Repealed by Laws 2000, Ch. 48, 3.Section 10-6-103 - Operating Aircraft While Under Influence of Alcohol or Drug; Penalty.Section 10-6-104 - Penalty for Violation of w.s. 10-4-101 Through 10-4-303.

sections.heading: Operating Aircraft While Under Influence of Alcohol or Drug; Penalty.
sections.text:
10-6-103. Operating aircraft while under influence of alcohol or drug; penalty.

(a) No person may act as a crew member of a civil aircraft within eight (8) hours after the consumption of any alcoholic beverage, or while under the influence of any intoxicating liquor, or while using any drug that affects his faculties in any way contrary to safety.

(b) Any person convicted of violating W.S. 10-6-103(a) shall be punished by a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars ($500.00), by imprisonment not to exceed six (6) months, or both.

sections.heading: Penalty for Violation of w.s. 10-4-101 Through 10-4-303.
sections.text:
10-6-104. Penalty for violation of W.S. 10-4-101 through 10-4-303.

A person who violates any provision of W.S. 10-4-101 through 10-4-303 is guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction shall be punished by a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars ($500.00), by imprisonment for not more than six (6) months, or both.
